summary: The Advancing Enrollment and Reducing Drug Costs Act (H.R. 2340) aims to amend Title XVIII of the Social Security Act regarding Medicare Part D.  It focuses on automatically qualifying certain Medicaid beneficiaries for premium and cost-sharing subsidies under the Medicare Part D program. Specifically, individuals under 65 enrolled in Medicaid under specific sections and with incomes below 200% of the poverty line would be treated as subsidy-eligible for a limited time. These changes would apply to plan years beginning January 1, 2027.
